question:
Now that fresh produce has become (i) _________—markets and stands in cities throughout the world boast dozens of varieties of fruits and vegetables for customers to choose from—many (ii) ________ that were once the inevitable result of nutritional deficiencies are now entirely (iii) ________.
Blank (i)
Blank (ii)
Blank (iii)
A. salubrious
D. maladies
G. organic
B. ubiquitous
E. reactions
H. dietetic
C. comestible
F. cultivars
I. preventable
Show
Hide
Answer
